com.dampcake.bencode

Class Bencode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dampcake.bencode.Bencode

  • public final class Bencode
extends Object
    Bencode encoder/decoder.
    Since:
    1.1
    Author:
    Adam Peck

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Bencode()
      Create a new Bencoder using the default Charset (UTF-8) and useBytes as false.
      Bencode(boolean useBytes)
      Creates a new Bencoder using the boolean passed to control String parsing.
      Bencode(Charset charset)
      Creates a new Bencoder using the Charset passed for encoding/decoding and useBytes as false.
      Bencode(Charset charset, boolean useBytes)
      Creates a new Bencoder using the Charset passed for encoding/decoding and boolean passed to control String parsing.

      • Bencode

        public Bencode(Charset charset)

        Parameters:
        charset - the Charset to use
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the Charset passed is null
        See Also:
        Bencode(Charset, boolean)

      • Bencode

        public Bencode(boolean useBytes)
        Creates a new Bencoder using the boolean passed to control String parsing.
        Parameters:
        useBytes - Bencode(Charset, boolean)
        Since:
        1.3

      • Bencode

        public Bencode(Charset charset,
               boolean useBytes)
        Creates a new Bencoder using the Charset passed for encoding/decoding and boolean passed to control String parsing. If useBytes is false, then dictionary values that contain byte string data will be coerced to a String. if useBytes is true, then dictionary values that contain byte string data will be coerced to a ByteBuffer.
        Parameters:
        charset - the Charset to use
        useBytes - true to have dictionary byte data to stay as bytes
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the Charset passed is null
        Since:
        1.3

    • Method Detail

      • getCharset

        public Charset getCharset()
        Gets the Charset the coder was created with.
        Returns:
        the Charset of the coder

      • type

        public Type type(byte[] bytes)
        Determines the first Type contained within the byte array.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the bytes to determine the Type for
        Returns:
        the Type or Type.UNKNOWN if it cannot be determined
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if bytes is null
        BencodeException - if an error occurs during detection

      • decode

        public <T> T decode(byte[] bytes,
                    Type<T> type)
        Decodes a bencode encoded byte array.
        Type Parameters:
        T - inferred from the Type parameter
        Parameters:
        bytes - the bytes to decode
        type - the Type to decode as
        Returns:
        the decoded object
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if bytes or type is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if type is Type.UNKNOWN
        BencodeException - if an error occurs during decoding

      • encode

        public byte[] encode(String s)
        Encodes the passed String.
        Parameters:
        s - the String to encode
        Returns:
        the encoded bytes
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the String is null
        BencodeException - if an error occurs during encoding

      • encode

        public byte[] encode(Number n)
        Encodes the passed Number.

        The number is converted to a Long, meaning any precision is lost as it not supported by the bencode spec.

        Parameters:
        n - the Number to encode
        Returns:
        the encoded bytes
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the Number is null
        BencodeException - if an error occurs during encoding

      • encode

        public byte[] encode(Iterable<?> l)
        Encodes the passed Iterable as a bencode List.

        Data contained in the List is written as the correct type. Any Iterable is written as a List, any Number as a Number, any Map as a Dictionary and any other Object is written as a String calling the Object.toString() method.

        Parameters:
        l - the Iterable to encode
        Returns:
        the encoded bytes
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the List is null
        BencodeException - if an error occurs during encoding

      • encode

        public byte[] encode(Map<?,?> m)
        Encodes the passed Map as a bencode Dictionary.

        Data contained in the Dictionary is written as the correct type. Any Iterable is written as a List, any Number as a Number, any Map as a Dictionary and any other Object is written as a String calling the Object.toString() method.

        Parameters:
        m - the Map to encode
        Returns:
        the encoded bytes
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the Map is null
        BencodeException - if an error occurs during encoding
